intro: Pavetta filistipulata, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Pavetta filistipulata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
